subject: Re: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Test class can only have one constructor
msgSnippet: Hello Sharath. I don t see any point to have a constructor with argument for test case. Could you please share why would this kind of constructor is needed ?
messageBody:
Hello Sharath.

I don't see any point to have a constructor with argument for test case.
Could you please share why would this kind of constructor is needed ?

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, raj_sharath <raj_sharath@...> wrote:
>
>
> Hi-
>
> The following is my Test class
>
> import org.junit.Test;
> public class Test2 {
>
> public Test2()
> {
> System.out.println("Inside zero arg con");
> }
>
> public Test2(String arg)
> {
> System.out.println("Inside arg con");
> }
> @Test
> public void m1()
> {
> System.out.println("inside method m1()");
> }
> @Test
> public void m2()
> {
> System.out.println("inside method m2()");
> }
> }
>
> when i run it ..an exception is thrown...
>
> JUnit version 4.5
> .E
> Time: 0
> There was 1 failure:
> 1) initializationError(Test2)
> java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Test class can only have one
constructor
> at org.junit.runners.model.TestClass.<init>(TestClass.java:32)
> at org.junit.runners.ParentRunner.<init>(ParentRunner.java:54)
> at
> org.junit.runners.BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.<init>
(BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.java:56)
> at
> org.junit.internal.builders.JUnit4Builder.runnerForClass
(JUnit4Builder.java:13)
> at
> org.junit.runners.model.RunnerBuilder.safeRunnerForClass
(RunnerBuilder.java:57)
> at
> org.junit.internal.builders.AllDefaultPossibilitiesBuilder.runnerForClass
(AllDefaultPossibilitiesBuilder.java:29)
> at
> org.junit.runners.model.RunnerBuilder.safeRunnerForClass
(RunnerBuilder.java:57)
> at org.junit.runners.model.RunnerBuilder.runners
(RunnerBuilder.java:93)
> at org.junit.runners.model.RunnerBuilder.runners
(RunnerBuilder.java:84)
> at org.junit.runners.Suite.<init>(Suite.java:66)
> at org.junit.runner.Request.classes(Request.java:68)
> at org.junit.runner.JUnitCore.run(JUnitCore.java:107)
> at org.junit.runner.JUnitCore.runMain(JUnitCore.java:88)
> at org.junit.runner.JUnitCore.runMainAndExit(JUnitCore.java:54)
> at org.junit.runner.JUnitCore.main(JUnitCore.java:46)
>
> FAILURES!!!
> Tests run: 1, Failures: 1
>
> The question is,
>
> 1. Can a junit not have more than one public construtor
>
> 2. or is there any other reason for this failure
>
> Thanks
> sharath
>
>
>
>
> --

http://www.nabble.com/java.lang.IllegalArgumentException%3A-Test-
class-can-only-have-one-constructor-tp19791084p19791084.html
